message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common terms in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator:
6x^2 - 12x = 6x(x - 2)

Denominator:
18x^4 - 6x^3 = 6x^3(3x - 1)

Now, the rational expression becomes:

(6x(x - 2)) / (6x^3(3x - 1))

We can now cancel out the common term 6x:

(6x(x - 2)) / (6x^3(3x - 1)) = (x - 2) / (x^2(3x - 1))

The simplified rational expression is:

(x - 2) / (x^2(3x - 1))
